title: Seaplane, airstrip projects of Kerala hit a snag
content: The state government is yet to issue work orders for vital feasibility studies nearly two years after tenders were floated. Indecision stalls plans to integrate nearly 100 existing helipads and setting up airstrips in the State, despite Union government directives to expedite development under the UDAN scheme.

content: 4,11,578 Form 6 applications and 76,239 Form 6A applications have been filed since December 23, according to an update issued by the office of the Chief Electoral Officer.

content: The cabinet, chaired by CM Devendra Fadnavis, also okayed the revised cost and the State's share for the Mumbai Urban Transport Project  (MUTP-2), aimed at improving suburban rail and urban mobility infrastructure

title: Several Indians return from protest-hit Iran in commercial flights
content: As tensions escalate in Iran amid deadly protests and government crackdowns, Indian nationals, primarily students, are urged to prioritise their safety and return home, with the Indian Embassy offering support and guidance

title: Kerala unit of Janata Dal (S) merges with Indian Socialist Janata Dal (ISJD)
content: The Kerala unit of the party, which is an ally of the ruling LDF in the State, had unanimously rejected the decision of its supremo H.D. Deve Gowda to join hands with the BJP ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections.

content: PM Modi sought to reassure refugees such as the Matuas, who had migrated to India after facing religious persecution, amid the ongoing controversy over the SIR exercise

title: BMC poll results: Congress leader demands Mumbai unit chief Varsha Gaikwad's resignation

content: ‚ÄúSuper Smelters Limited Company would invest around ‚Çπ8,570 crores for its steel plant to be set up in Gurla mandal of the district,‚Äù says Minister for MSME and NRI affairs

content: The Foundation has set a target of spending ‚Çπ4,000 crore over the next five years to build and operate a 1,000-bed charitable super-speciality and multi-organ transplant hospital in Bengaluru

content: The proposal was cleared by Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge, after which an official letter confirming Mr. Malviya's return to the party was issued late on January 16

title: MRB exam candidates in Tamil Nadu request allocation of same centre for two exams
content: MRB is conducting the examinations to fill 1,100 vacant posts of assistant surgeon (general) and 299 vacant posts of assistant surgeon (general) with speciality qualification.

content: Phool Singh Baraiya, legislator from Bhander in Datia, made the remarks during an interview to a media outlet and a video clip soon went viral on social media

title: Treaties should be driven by national interest, not pressure from foreign govts or corporations: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court emphasises the need for India to prioritise its economic sovereignty in international tax agreements, laying out essential principles to ensure fairness and prevent the influence of external pressures

title: Bengaluru Rural MP flags need for 650-bed hospital at proposed RGUHS medical college campus in Ramanagara
content: The existing district hospital has 250 beds, and is located nearly 3 km from the new campus, posing challenges in integrating academic training, emergency care, and utilisation of manpower and facilities, the MP stated

title: Fresh unrest in Murshidabad, police resort to baton charge to disperse mobs
content: Superintendent of Police, Murshidabad said that there were blockades put up by mobs which have been cleared after police action.

content: Adoor Prakash says deliberately turning issues that can be resolved legally into criminal cases is not truth-seeking but planned political weaponisation to divert public attention from corruption allegations plaguing Left govt

content: The focus of the operation was to disrupt the organized network, identify key operatives, and collect evidence against those involved, says Keonjhar SP Kusalkar Nitin Dagudu

title: Indian Army successfully builds third 120-feet-long Bailey bridge in Sri Lanka
content: This achievement follows the earlier successful launch of two Bailey bridges in the Jaffna and Kandy regions.

title: Overhaul of import tariff structure, customs processes to cut trade costs, boost manufacturing, exports: GTRI
content: Tariffs are no longer a revenue tool, as customs duties now account for just 6% of gross tax revenue and average only 3.9% of the value of imports, it added.

content: ‚ÄúBy significantly reducing travel time by around 2.5 hours on the Howrah‚ÄìGuwahati route, the train will also give a major boost to religious travel and tourism,‚Äùa statement issued by the PMO stated

title: Rape case: Kerala MLA Rahul Mamkootathil‚Äôs bail plea rejected, to remain in jail
content: Rahul Mamkootathil, who was arrested from Palakkad on January 11, is expected to approach the sessions court for bail. The application is scheduled to be filed on Monday

title: West Bengal has no ‚Äòjaatiwad‚Äô: Manoranjan Byapari
content: Byapari‚Äôs books have always drawn from real rootless and marginalised people like him who make railway platforms and slums their home.

content: ‚ÄúThe Act, envisioned under the leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, legally assures 125 days of employment in rural areas and strengthens livelihood opportunities and village-level infrastructure,‚Äù says AP Deputy Chief Minister

content: State executive member Kameswara Rao said the CPI national body will give a clear road map for the strengthening of the party from grass root level in all the districts of Andhra Pradesh

content: He visited four patients undergoing treatment at Bombay Hospital, a private facility, enquired about their health, and met their family members

content: The State administration made elaborate security arrangements to maintain peace across districts, a senior police officer said, adding that additional forces have been deployed in the State‚Äôs capital Ranchi

content: In a conversation with N. Ravi, the former Chief Justice says national security laws have turned the basic principles of bail on their head

content: Khandre played an important role in the Karnataka Ekikarana (state unification) movement, especially in campaigns to ensure that Kannada-speaking districts of the erstwhile Hyderabad State, including Bidar, became part of Karnataka

content: U.S. and Pakistani troops concluded a joint training at the National Counter-Terrorism Centre in Pabbi during the exercise, 'Inspired Gambit 2026'

content: Dilnoor lodged a written complaint with SSP Mohali on January 6. Police have initiated an investigation into the matter

content: The nun, who chose to reveal her identity this time, said she was grateful that her request to government had been accepted. She thanked Kerala government, Chief Minister, and the general public for the support extended to her

title: Prohibitory orders imposed in Jalna over Dhangar agitation
content: District Collector Ashima Mittal issued an order under Section 163 in the BNSS, which deals with prohibitory orders for public safety, nuisance, or danger

content: Case registered based on a complaint by the Congress leader against pages named ‚ÄòCommunist Kerala‚Äô and ‚ÄòJohn Brittas Fans Group‚Äô for allegedly spreading false and misleading content, say police

content: The gunfight erupted in the morning hours in the forested hills of the northwest region of the district

title: 4.1 magnitude earthquake hits Gujarat‚Äôs Kutch district; no casualties
content: The quake was recorded at 1:22 a.m. with its epicentre about 55 km north northeast (NNE) from Khavda in the district, says the Gandhinagar-based ISR

title: Guru Tegh Bahadur row: Delhi Speaker says forensic analysis found video not tampered with
content: The report clearly says that the alleged remark by Atishi was found matching frame by frame in the video clip, and it was original and there was no tampering involved, says Delhi Assembly Speaker Vijender Gupta

title: Forest Department captures elephant that killed woman in Hassan
content: Even after being hit by a tranquilizer, the elephant continued to move around for some time, forcing the staff to track its movement with drones

title: Alanganallur jallikattu begins on a high in Tamil Nadu
content: The winner would walk home with a brand new car, while the runner-up would be given a two-wheeler. The third prize is an e-bike

title: Maharashtra civic polls: BJP clinches 1,425 seats across 29 municipal corporations
content: The BJP won 89, and ally Shiv Sena bagged 29 seats in the 227-member BMC, while Shiv Sena (UBT) managed 65 and MNS six seats

title: Russian man held for killing two female compatriots in north Goa
content: According to police official, Russian national Aleksei Leonov allegedly killed his friend Elena Vaneeva (37) in her room at Morjim on January 14 by slitting her neck with a knife

title: Samakka-Saralamma Jatara: The big tribal spiritual reset
content: As Telangana prepares for the biennial Sammakka-Saralamma Jatara, one of the world‚Äôs largest indigenous spiritual gatherings, the sacred heart of Medaram village has turned into a vast worksite. The redevelopment is designed to accommodate more devotees at the worship altar.¬†Serish Nanisetti¬†reports on a transformation unfolding at an unprecedented scale

title: How banking bottlenecks slow cybercrime investigations in Telangana
content: Fraudsters use every second, pushing funds through layers of mule accounts spread across multiple banks, while  investigators must track all transactions and alert each bank individually; this has to be done manually, unable to match the speed at which the funds disperse

title: 53-year-old arrested after acid attack on minor girl in Kerala‚Äôs Wayanad
content: According to police, the attack occurred on Friday evening. Police said there were ‚Äòmultiple issues‚Äô between the neighbours that led to the incident

title: KGMU case: VHP protests in Lucknow over alleged religious conversions
content: The protesters urged the Special Task Force (STF), which is probing the case, to expedite the investigation and ensure stringent action against the guilty

title: SAD flags threat to Majithia's life inside jail, seeks Punjab Governor's intervention
content: The SAD appealed to Governor Gulab Chand Kataria to issue necessary directions to ensure the security of Majithia, a former Minister, saying it had no faith in the AAP government to take effective steps in this regard

title: Government aims to ‚Äòformally recognise‚Äô 1 lakh tribal healers from STs as ‚Äòpartners in health services‚Äô
content: At the plenary session, the Ministry of Tribal Affairs also signed MoU with the ICMR‚ÄìRegional Medical Research Centre, Bhubaneswar, to set up India‚Äôs first National Tribal Health Observatory, to be known as the Bharat Tribal Health Observatory.

title: ‚ÄòNo entry for non-Hindus‚Äô: Har ki Pauri boards cite century-old bylaw; officials say no fresh order
content: New notice boards citing a century-old bylaw restricting non-Hindus at Har-ki-Pauri have been installed by the Ganga Sabha. The body aims to enforce rules framed in 1916, stating only those connected to Sanatan Dharma should enter the holy site. While the Ganga Sabha seeks wider implementation, district officials emphasize that enforcement depends on civic authorities and adherence to the law.

title: ‚ÄòSubject to judicial process‚Äô: Embassy on Indian crew detained in Iran; seeks ‚Äòconsular access‚Äô
content: India is actively engaging Iran to secure the release of 16 Indian crew members detained on the MT Valiant Roar since December. New Delhi is pressing for consular access, communication with families, and legal representation, while also ensuring the vessel's provisions. The detention follows Iran's seizure of the tanker for alleged illegal fuel transport.

title: California wealth tax: Google cofounder moves to Miami: Larry Page buys two estates for $170 m
content: Google co-founder Larry Page has purchased two sprawling estates in Miami's Coconut Grove for over $170 million, marking a significant move from California. This relocation coincides with the Golden State's proposed wealth tax on its richest residents, a measure that could prompt further capital flight.  Page's departure follows similar actions by other tech titans.

title: 'BJP won polls by betrayal': Uddhav's 1st address after BMC drubbing, says 'battle not over'
content: Following BMC election results, Uddhav Thackeray asserted Shiv Sena (UBT) remains strong despite BJP's alleged betrayal and attempts to buy loyalty. The Thackeray-led alliance secured significant wins in Mumbai's Marathi heartland, though they lost control of the BMC after nearly three decades to the Mahayuti alliance.

title: Zuckerberg hired Wang for $14bn ‚Äî now they‚Äôre clashing
content: Meta's new structure reveals tension between Mark Zuckerberg and Alexandr Wang, the $14 billion AI recruit. Wang finds Zuckerberg's micromanagement stifling, while staff question his leadership for Meta's AI ambitions. A recent strategy clash highlighted differing priorities, with Wang pushing for cutting-edge AI over immediate product integration.

title: 'Axar is way ahead of Jadeja': Ex-India cricketer's blunt verdict
content: Ravindra Jadeja's ODI form is under scrutiny due to quiet performances with bat and ball, with recent numbers raising questions. Mohammad Kaif believes Axar Patel is a superior option in white-ball cricket, citing batting prowess and bowling versatility. Kaif also questioned team selection, advocating for Axar's inclusion over Nitish Kumar Reddy for better balance.

title: 'Asli poriborton': PM Modi says TMC converting 'infiltrators into voters' in Bengal - what he said
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed a rally in Malda, West Bengal, advocating for "asli poribortan" and criticizing the Mamata Banerjee-led Trinamool Congress. He highlighted BJP's recent poll victories in Bihar, Odisha, and Assam, stating these states have been freed from "divisive politics." Modi expressed confidence in Bengal's "urge for real change" to achieve a developed India by 2047.

title: Sunjay Kapur inheritance row: Priya Sachdev files criminal defamation case against Mandhira
content: In a fresh escalation of the ongoing legal battle over late businessman Sunjay Kapur‚Äôs estate, his widow Priya Sachdev Kapur has filed a criminal defamation complaint against Sunjay‚Äôs sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, and another individual.

title: $1m prize: Elon Musk‚Äôs X offers reward for best long-form article; winners out January 30
content: Elon Musk's X is launching a $1 million prize for the best long-form article, aiming to boost high-impact content and writing on the platform. This initiative, part of X's 2026 growth strategy, encourages creators to produce in-depth pieces that shape conversations and break news. The move follows the introduction of X's 'Articles' feature, allowing for longer posts beyond traditional limits.

title: JEE Main 2026 admit card released: Check direct link, how to access session 1 hall ticket here
content: The National Testing Agency has released the JEE Main 2026 January session admit card on its official website. Candidates can download their hall tickets using their application number and date of birth. The January session exams are scheduled from January 21 to January 29, 2026, with the second session in April.

title: B'desh: Journalists demand protection after attacks on national dailies; slam Yunus govt
content: Bangladesh journalists and media owners are demanding safety after violent mob attacks on major newspapers.  Staff were trapped as offices were torched and looted.  Concerns are mounting over press freedom and democratic institutions ahead of elections, with critics pointing to the interim government's slow response and broader issues of harassment and surveillance.

title: BBL: Embarrassment for Pakistan; Babar, Rizwan top unwanted list
content: Pakistan stars Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan endured a tough BBL 2026, topping the list of the slowest batters with strike rates of 107.48 and 102.74. Babar‚Äôs frustration was visible after a mid-pitch clash with Steve Smith, before his dismissal. Rizwan, meanwhile, became the first overseas player in BBL history to be retired out, highlighting concerns over their T20 tempo.

title: Salman was happiest with Aishwarya during this film; Kumar Sanu reveals
content: Singer Kumar Sanu recently revealed that Salman Khan was exceptionally happy during the filming of 'Hum Dil De Chuke Sanam.' He described both Salman and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan as incredibly beautiful, noting their real-life chemistry translated powerfully on screen. Sanu's comments highlight the enduring impact of their pairing in the iconic 1999 film.

title: ‚ÄòNot regular activity‚Äô: MEA on why India skipped BRICS naval drills; cites IBSAMAR
content: India clarified its non-participation in a recent South African-led naval exercise involving some BRICS nations, stating it was not an official BRICS activity. The Ministry of External Affairs emphasized that the drill was a South African initiative, unlike the regular IBSAMAR exercise India conducts with Brazil and South Africa. India currently chairs the expanded BRICS bloc.

title: Dragged my luggage in scotching sun, till my hands bled: Goa experience I don‚Äôt want to remember
content: Travellers in Goa face significant challenges with local taxi services. Many report inflated prices and harassment from taxi operators. App-based ride-hailing services struggle to operate due to the powerful local taxi union. This situation creates a stressful and negative experience for visitors, overshadowing the state's attractions. Ensuring fair and accessible transport is crucial for Goa's tourism.

title: Handshake drama returns! India, Bangladesh captains refuse pleasantries at U-19 World Cup
content: India and Bangladesh U-19 captains notably skipped the customary handshake at the toss, reflecting strained bilateral relations. This follows a pattern seen in previous matches involving Indian teams and Pakistan. Recent political tensions between India and Bangladesh have also impacted cricket, with player releases and security concerns raised.

title: Javed Akhtar reacts to AR Rahman communal remark controversy
content: AR Rahman's recent comments about fewer Bollywood opportunities and a potential communal reason have sparked industry debate. Veteran screenwriter Javed Akhtar and Shobhaa De have expressed disbelief, suggesting fear of Rahman's stature, not communal bias, keeps people away. Rahman himself hinted at a power shift favoring non-creative individuals, leading to indirect exclusion.

title: 'Matter of just one wicket': Mohammed Siraj backs Ravindra Jadeja to roar back
content: Pacer Mohammed Siraj expressed full faith in Ravindra Jadeja's bowling ahead of the series decider, stating a single wicket will reignite his form.  Siraj acknowledged missed chances cost India in the second ODI, particularly against Daryl Mitchell. He emphasized a healthy team environment despite the series being tied, and discussed bowling plans for the small Indore ground.

title: ‚ÄòTwo good signs‚Äô: Tharoor says Iran tensions ‚Äònot increasing‚Äô; cites execution halt, softer US tone
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor sees hopeful signs of de-escalation in Iran, citing reports of cancelled executions and a toned-down US military stance. He believes regional nations desire stability, suggesting a potential turning point despite limited information access.  Meanwhile, Tharoor expressed skepticism about peace in Gaza, noting ongoing violence.

title: Beyond the badge: The unseen burden of independent Indian women
content: Modern Indian women are celebrated as independent, yet this often masks exhaustion from constant negotiation and performance.  Once a thrilling discovery, independence now carries immense pressure, demanding visible strength and early responsibility.  This evolution highlights a generational truth: independence is expected early, learned through observing the sacrifices of others, and often met with criticism.

title: Pakistan: 23 killed in separate road accidents amid dense fog; 6 children among dead
content: Tragic road accidents in Pakistan claimed at least 23 lives, including six children, on Saturday. A truck plunged into a dry canal in Sargodha, killing 14, while nine perished when a passenger coach overturned near Gwadar. Dense fog and over-speeding are blamed for the devastating incidents, highlighting ongoing traffic safety concerns.

title: Peanut lodged in the lung, oxygen at 40%: Two infants narrowly escape death in Faridabad
content: Two Faridabad infants narrowly escaped death after accidentally inhaling food particles, leading to critical respiratory failure. Doctors at Amrita Hospital performed emergency procedures, removing a peanut from one-year-old's airway and using advanced cryotherapy for an eight-month-old's lodged object. Timely, specialized intervention saved both lives, highlighting the dangers of foreign body aspiration in infants.

title: 24 is panicking, 34 is exhausted: The fears of young India in 2026
content: India's youth, comprising millennials and Gen Z, face distinct anxieties shaped by differing political, economic, and technological landscapes. While millennials fear instability after years of effort, Gen Z grapples with the prospect of never achieving stability. Both generations navigate concerns over job security, economic inequality, and climate change, highlighting a cautious outlook on their future.

title: 'If America embraces Indians...': US lawmakers draw sharp India‚ÄìPakistan contrast
content: Senior US lawmakers emphasized India's central role in America's Indo-Pacific strategy, highlighting its importance for global stability and strong economic ties. They clarified that routine engagement with Pakistan does not signify a strategic shift, as India remains the primary focus for US investments and partnerships.

title: Bengaluru shocker: Woman sets self, 4-year-old daughter on fire after fight with husband
content: A Bengaluru woman died after setting herself and her four-year-old daughter on fire following a dispute with her husband. The daughter also succumbed to her burns. In a separate incident, a 22-year-old woman was rescued after attempting suicide due to her lover's refusal to marry her.

title: 'Which adivasi woman is beautiful?': Congress MLA's bizarre theory on rape causes outrage
content: A Congress MLA from Madhya Pradesh, Phool Singh, has sparked controversy by linking rape to religious scriptures. He  alsoclaimed that seeing a beautiful woman could disturb a man, leading to rape. He further alleged that certain texts promise spiritual rewards for sexual acts with women from Dalit or tribal communities, even if they were not beautiful.

title: 'Clean water not available even today': Rahul Gandhi meets Indore victims
content: Rahul Gandhi visited Indore to meet victims of a water contamination outbreak, offering condolences to families of the deceased and consoling the ill. He criticized the government's 'urban model,' highlighting the lack of clean drinking water and demanding accountability and compensation for affected families.

title: 'Battle not over': Thackeray cousins react to BMC debacle; Uddhav posts Bal Thackeray's photo
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) and MNS leaders declared the fight for Marathi identity and dignity is far from over following BMC election results. Despite limited success, both parties vowed to fiercely protect Marathi interests against perceived attempts to undermine them. Raj Thackeray urged elected representatives to remain resolute, emphasizing the long-term nature of their struggle for a prosperous Maharashtra.

title: Did soft Hindutva hit Uddhav hard? Behind the setback of ‚ÄòThackeray brand‚Äô in BMC
content: The Shiv Sena (Uddhav Balasaheb Thackeray) and Raj Thackeray's Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) combine had framed the BMC polls as a battle to ‚Äúsave the Marathi manoos and Mumbai, projecting the contest as both an assertion of regional pride and a referendum on the Thackeray legacy. ‚ÄãThe reunion of Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray after nearly two decades was billed as an acid test for the Thackeray brand.

title: Krishna Kumar reveals tough phase of daughter Diya Krishna‚Äôs pregnancy
content: Actor Krishna Kumar's daughter, Diya Krishna, faced immense distress during her final pregnancy stages due to a Rs. 69 lakh financial fraud at her boutique. Trusted staff allegedly masterminded the theft and filed a false case against Diya and her father. A Crime Branch probe cleared them, confirming the staff's guilt.

title: Four new Amrit Bharat Express! PM Modi flags off trains - check routes & schedule
content: New Amrit Bharat Express trains: PM Narendra Modi virtually flagged off four new Amrit Bharat Express services, expanding affordable long-distance rail connectivity and strengthening mobility and economic linkages across multiple states.

title: 'Never seen before': Cheetah mummies found in Saudi caves
content: Extremely rare mummified cheetah remains, some over 1,800 years old, were discovered in northern Saudi Arabian caves. Researchers found seven mummies and 54 other cheetah skeletons, offering unprecedented insights into ancient cheetah genetics and their historical presence in the region. This discovery could aid future conservation efforts.

title: Expert reveals why modern students prioritise passion and affordability over popular universities
content: Studying abroad priorities are shifting. Gen Z students now focus on specific courses and professors over university brands. Practical factors like safety and affordability are also key. This thoughtful approach guides their decisions for future careers. Universities must highlight program strengths and faculty expertise to attract these students.

title: May we? Thieves wake 76-year-old woman from sleep, seek ‚Äòcooperation‚Äô, tie her up, steal Rs65k
content: In a peculiar burglary, four men entered a 76-year-old woman's home in Kheda district, politely waking her and requesting cooperation before tying her up. They calmly searched for valuables, taking Rs 15,000 cash and a gold ring. The woman was unharmed and alerted the watchman in the morning.

title: Damien Martyn's emotional 'I'm back' post after beating Meningitis
content: Former Australian cricketer Damien Martyn has returned home after a severe bout of meningitis, which saw him placed in an induced coma for eight days. He described the experience as a stark reminder of life's fragility, expressing immense gratitude to medical staff, family, and friends for their unwavering support during his recovery.

title: Iran unrest: Over 3,000 killed in nationwide protests; toll deadliest in decades
content: Nationwide protests in Iran have claimed over 3,000 lives, marking the deadliest unrest in decades. While authorities appear to have quelled demonstrations for now, internet connectivity remains severely restricted. The protests, initially sparked by economic woes, escalated into widespread challenges against the clerical leadership, drawing international attention and prompting a cautious response from the US.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper flagged off: Howrah-Kamakhya train launched by PM Modi
content: Vande Bharat sleeper launch today: PM Narendra Modi flagged off Indian Railways' first Vande Bharat sleeper train set today. The new air-conditioned train will run between Howrah and Kamakhya, providing a premium and faster overnight travel option.

title: R-Day alert: Intel flags terror threat from Bangladeshi, Khalistani outfits; Delhi among targets
content: Delhi and other major cities are on high alert for Republic Day due to intelligence warnings of potential attacks by Khalistani and Bangladesh-based terror groups.  These outfits are reportedly using Punjab-based gangsters as operatives, with increasing links to criminal networks across North India. Security forces are enhancing surveillance to counter these threats.

title: Decoding Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad civic polls: Landslide win for BJP, combined NCPs no match
content: The BJP secured decisive victories in both Pune and Pimpri Chinchwad municipal corporations, exceeding their previous performance. This outcome dashed the hopes of the NCP alliance, led by Ajit Pawar and Sharad Pawar, to reclaim their former strongholds. The results signal a significant setback for the NCP factions, prompting a need for strategic adjustments.

title: From Gauri Lankesh murder accused to gangster kin: How Maharashtra voted for tainted corporators
content: Maharashtra civic polls saw controversial wins, including two relatives of jailed gangster Suryakant Andekar elected in Pune. In Jalna, Shrikant Pangarkar, an accused in journalist Gauri Lankesh's murder, secured a victory as an independent. These results have sparked significant public debate and criticism.

title: Aditya Dhar reacts to 'Dhurandhar 2' release date postponement rumors
content: Aditya Dhar's latest blockbuster, 'Dhurandhar', featuring the charismatic Ranveer Singh, is smashing box office records left and right. Rumors about a delay for the sequel have been put to rest, as Dhar announced that 'Dhurandhar 2' is set for a timely release on March 19, 2026, even though it may face competition from Yash's highly anticipated film, 'Toxic'.

title: 'There's No One With Me': 8-Year-Old Boy Takes Mother's Body To Hospital
content: An eight-year-old boy found himself alone at a hospital as he arranged the postmortem examination of his mother, who died of HIV-related infection, until local police stepped in to help him with legal formalities and the last rites.

title: Manipur Census Without Removing 'Any Kuki Tribes' "Dangerous": Thadou Tribe Groups
content: Manipur's Thadou tribe draw attention to what they called "reckless, irresponsible, and inherently dangerous" decision to start the census exercise in the border state without first removing Any Kuki Tribes from the ST list.

title: Rahul Gandhi's "Smart City" Jab As He Meets Families Hit By Water Contamination In Indore
content: A smart city with no drinking water, quipped Rahul Gandhi as he arrived in Indore, India's so-called "cleanest city", to meet victims of the contaminated water tragedy in the city's Bhagirathpura area.

title: Hindu Woman In Bridal Attire, Muslim Man Found Hanging From Tree In UP: Cops
content: A Muslim man and an 18-year-old Hindu woman dressed in bridal attire were found hanging from a tree here on Saturday, with police suspecting that the duo took the extreme step after her marriage was fixed elsewhere.

title: "Guilty For Causalities, Damages": Iran's Khamenei Blames Trump For Unrest
content: Iran's supreme leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei on Saturday accused US President Donald Trump of being responsible for "casualties" during a protest wave in the country that rights groups said was met with a deadly crackdown.

title: Video: Biker Pulls Out Knife, Threatens Car Driver In Bengaluru Road Rage
content: Dashboard camera footage from a car showed yet another terrifying road rage incident in Bengaluru, days after a delivery rider was thrashed by a group of men after their two-wheelers brushed past on a narrow road.

title: Thousands Join 'Hands Off Greenland' Protests In Denmark Amid Trump Push
content: Thousands of people took to the streets of Denmark's capital on Saturday to protest at US President Donald Trump's push to take over Greenland, an autonomous Danish territory.

title: Hindu Man Run Over For Demanding Fuel Payment At Bangladesh Petrol Pump
content: 30-year-old Ripon Saha, a fuel station worker, tried to stop the vehicle from leaving the petrol pump without paying for the fuel, but the car allegedly ran over him before fleeing.

title: Karnataka Biker Crashes Into Wall After Being Chased By Stray Dog, Dies
content: A 44-year-old man was killed in a road accident in Athani town, Belagavi district, after a stray dog chased his motorcycle, causing him to lose control and crash into the wall of a house.

title: US Talks With Venezuelan Minister Cabello Began Months Before Raid: Report
content: Trump administration officials had been in discussions with Venezuela's hardline interior minister Diosdado Cabello months before the US operation to seize President Nicolas Maduro.

title: Why Maharashtra Civic Polls Have Silver Linings For All Parties, Except NCPs
content: The elections to 29 municipal corporations in Maharashtra, including the all-important BMC, may have one clear winner in the BJP, but most other parties also have some positives they can take away.

title: Priya Kapur Files Criminal Defamation Case Against Sunjay Kapur's Sister
content: Priya Sachdeva Kapur has moved a criminal defamation complaint against Sunjay Kapur's sister, Mandhira Kapur Smith, and another individual.

title: 5 From Gujarat Killed After SUV Hits Road Divider On Punjab Highway: Cops
content: Five Gujarat residents, including a woman constable, were killed when their sports utility vehicle hit a road divider on a national highway near Gurthari village in Punjab's Bathinda district on Saturday, police said.

title: Explained: How And By When Will Mumbai Get New Mayor?
content: Mumbai will get a new mayor by the end of this month, following the BJP and Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena's big win in the BMC election. Uddhav Thackeray's Shiv Sena faction has lost control of the richest municipal body in the country.

title: Kanpur Man, 22, Murders Wife Before Surrendering To Cops In UP
content: Commotion broke out at the Maharajpur police station in Kanpur on Saturday morning when a young man walked in crying and told the inspector, "Sir... I have strangled my wife. Her body is lying at home wrapped in a blanket."

title: "Fake Patients, On-Paper Doctors": How Al Falah University Misled Regulators
content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday said it has attached the land and building of Haryana-based Al Falah University, worth about Rs 140 crore, that came under the radar of the security agencies following the November 10 Red Fort area blast.

title: Resort Politics In Mumbai Again: Shinde Camp's Big Move After BMC Results
content: Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde's Shiv Sena has started moving its elected representatives in Mumbai to a five-star hotel, a day after it emerged as the kingmaker in theBrihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections.

title: 'God Willing, Will Have Our Party's Mayor In Mumbai': Uddhav Thackeray
content: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray on Saturday said if God is willing, the party could have its mayor in Mumbai, remarks coming a day after the BJP-Eknath Shinde-led Shiv Sena combine won the civic elections in the financial capital.

title: Delhi Gets 'Zero-Tolerance' Zones To Ease Traffic Congestion In Busy Areas
content: In a major move to curb traffic violations and ease congestion at critical stretches, 'Zero Tolerance' Zones have been created across some of the busiest corridors in New Delhi.

title: All About UN Biodiversity Treaty That Aims To Protect 30% Of Oceans By 2030
content: A landmark global treaty to safeguard biodiversity in the high seas came into effect on Saturday, providing countries with a legally binding framework to tackle threats such as overfishing.

title: Rams-Bears set to join list of coldest playoff games
content: temperatures could drop to single digits for divisional round game between los Angeles Rams and the Chicago Bears . if 2 degrees is where we end up, the Rams-Bears still won't be among the top five coldest playoff games . the 1967 NFL championship reigns supreme as the coldest postseason game .

title: How Darnold-to-Smith-Njigba fuels Seahawks' playoff run
content: the god-given right to a drama-free existence is the first article of their constitution . head coach Mike Macdonald speaks as if he pre-scans every sentence through an algorithm that removes any trace of personality . the quarterback, Sam Darnold, is so aggressively bland that it's become endearing .

title: 10 NBA teams that could swing trade season's final 20 days
content: the league's three-week sprint to the Feb. 5 trade deadline is here . many contenders are still deciding on a direction . a weekly trip around the Association focuses on those teams trying to add to their rosters .

title: From a client call to suiting up for a Chicago Blackhawks game: Inside David Nozzolillo's wild Friday
content: nozzolillo was on the phone with a client until 5 p.m. and missed a call from Danny Tranchida . the 45-year-old's nights are often spent in the beer leagues . he was a former goalie at lake forest college .

title: Why Miami's Columbus High School can't lose the CFP title game
content: the "Get Up" team gives its national championship picks . the school is 5 miles from the University of Miami and 20 miles from Hard Rock Stadium . it's home to the Explorers, who have seven people representing the school .

title: All-Pro LBs to coaches: How Texans' Ryans, Patriots' Vrabel have revived former teams
content: deMeco Ryans' first season as coach of the Houston Texans was interrupted by a fan in a grocery store . he was drawn back by the success and renewed energy the former linebacker had brought to texans football . the fan said he had started watching football again, but he couldn't stomach the losing .

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, each team's midseason fantasy MVP
content: we're identifying the midseason fantasy hockey MVP for all 32 clubs . it's not too late to sign up for ESPN Fantasy Hockey . a panel of commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday .

title: 2026 draft: Which underclassmen have declared?
content: the 2026 draft is three months away, so the class is starting to take shape . the deadline for underclassmen to declare for this draft class was January 14 . players from both teams meet in the college football playoff national championship .

title: Premier League live updates: Man United host Man City in first game under Carrick
content: We are back with some  Premier League  action and with that, some entertaining matches to feast on! We kick things off in style with the Manchester derby at Old Trafford, where  Manchester United  -- now under interim boss Michael Carrick -- will take on their neighbors  Manchester City  in the early match. Later, we will have  Chelsea  -- now under Liam Rosenior -- in action against  Brentford ,  Liverpool  taking on  Burnley  and finally, we have  Nottingham Forest  taking on league leaders  Arsenal  to finish the day off. Enjoy all the updates from Saturday's matches.

title: The resurgence of Vance Joseph: How the former Broncos head coach has keyed the defense
content: defensive coordinator Vance Joseph was 38 years old and looking for his next coaching job . he was hired by then- Houston Texans coach Gary Kubiak to join the team . his r√©sum√© includes coordinator gigs with the Miami Dolphins and the Arizona Cardinals .

title: MLB offseason grades: Mets pivot to Bichette after Dodgers sign top free agent Tucker
content: the 2025-26 offseason is officially here, and we have you covered with grades and analysis for every major signing and trade this winter . the deal: three years, $126 million with opt-outs after first two seasons Grade: B- The new york Mets have a new heart .
